intro: Gentiana praecox f. albiflora, commonly known as the early gentian with white flowers, is a flowering plant belonging to the Gentianaceae family. It is characterized by its striking white to pale blue flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant is native to mountainous regions of Europe and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
